qas.question: How many states did West Germany have at its founding?
What was West Berlin under the sovereignty of?
Which state was West Berlin apart of?

answers.text: neither a Western German state nor part of one

qas.question: How many states was Germany reduced to in 1952
When South Baden was formed in 1952, how many states were there?
What were the number of states reduced to in Saar Protectorate in 1949?
What states merged to form Saarland in 1952?
Who was South Baden under the authority of?
What kind of status did Saarland have when integrated with West Germany?
How many states did West Germany add after it's founding in 1952?
When was the Saar Protectorate given to the French?
What are referred to as the 'new states'?
What German state did West Berlin fall under?

context: Upon its founding in <b11_0>1949<b11_0/>, West Germany had <a0_0><b5_0>eleven<b5_0/><a0_0/> states. These were reduced to <b6_0><b10_0>nine<b10_0/><b6_0/> in <a4_0>1952<a4_0/> when three south-western states <b7_0>(South Baden, Württemberg-Hohenzollern, and Württemberg-Baden)<b7_0/> merged to form Baden-Württemberg. From <a3_0><b12_0>1957<b12_0/><a3_0/>, when the French-occupied Saar Protectorate was returned and formed into the Saarland, the <b13_0>Federal Republic<b13_0/> consisted of ten states, which are referred to as the "Old States" today. West Berlin was under the sovereignty of <b8_0>the <a1_0>Western Allies<b8_0/><a1_0/> and <a2_0>neither a <b14_0>Western German<b14_0/> state nor part of one<a2_0/>. However, it was in many ways de facto integrated with West Germany under a <b9_0>special status<b9_0/>.
